text: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult team member. How did you handle it?
followUp: What did you learn from that experience?

text: Describe a situation where you had to meet a tight deadline. How did you prioritize your work?
followUp: Would you do anything differently now?

text: Give me an example of a project that failed. What was your role and what did you learn?
followUp: How have you applied those lessons since?

text: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a customer or colleague.
followUp: What motivated you to do so?

text: If you disagreed with your manager about a key decision, how would you handle it?
followUp: What if they still disagreed after you presented your case?

text: Imagine you have multiple urgent tasks due at the same time. How would you decide what to work on first?
followUp: How would you communicate this to stakeholders?

text: What would you do if you noticed a colleague was struggling but hadn't asked for help?
followUp: How would you approach them?

text: Walk me through your approach to debugging a complex issue in production.
followUp: How do you prevent similar issues in the future?

text: How do you stay current with industry trends and new technologies?
followUp: Give an example of how you applied something new you learned.

text: Describe your experience with code reviews. What do you look for when reviewing code?
followUp: How do you handle disagreements in code reviews?

text: What motivates you to do your best work?
followUp: How does this role align with that motivation?

text: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
followUp: How does this position help you get there?

text: What attracted you to this role and our company?
followUp: What would make you stay long-term?

text: Describe your ideal work environment.
followUp: How do you adapt when the environment isn't ideal?

text: How do you prefer to receive feedback?
followUp: Give an example of feedback that helped you grow.

text: What does work-life balance mean to you?
followUp: How do you maintain it during busy periods?

text: How do you handle working with people who have different working styles than you?
followUp: Can you give a specific example?

text: Tell me about a time you were responsible for building or scaling a growth or marketing function from scratch. What was your approach and what were the results?
followUp: What would you do differently if you were to build that function again at Curacel?

text: Describe a growth strategy you personally owned that involved multiple channels such as performance marketing, partnerships, and product marketing.
followUp: How did you prioritize channels when resources or data were limited?

text: Imagine Curacel wants to aggressively grow adoption among insurers and HMOs in a new African market within 90 days. How would you structure your growth plan?
followUp: What assumptions would you test first, and how quickly?

text: Tell me about a time when a growth initiative failed or significantly underperformed. What happened?
followUp: How did you communicate the outcome to leadership and what actions did you take next?

text: How have you previously tracked and reported core growth metrics such as CAC, LTV, retention, revenue, or NPS?
followUp: Which metric do you believe is most dangerous to misinterpret, and why?

text: Describe a situation where you had to move very fast on a growth opportunity with incomplete data.
followUp: What guardrails did you put in place to manage risk while moving quickly?

text: How do you personally stay energized and motivated when growth targets are aggressive and timelines are tight?
Tell me about a time you challenged an existing assumption or playbook and introduced a new growth idea that worked.
followUp: What resistance did you face, and how did you bring others along?

text: If you joined Curacel and discovered that growth, sales, and product teams were misaligned, how would you address it?
followUp: What would you do in your first 30 days to create alignment?

text: What motivates you to work in growth roles, particularly within an insurtech or fintech environment like Curacel?
followUp: What aspects of this role would be most frustrating for you if not handled well?

text: How do you ensure your team stays accountable and empowered while still maintaining high standards and urgency?
followUp: Can you share a specific example where someone on your team exceeded expectations under your leadership?

text: Tell me about a time you were asked to build or significantly scale a growth or marketing function from scratch. What was your approach and what were the first 90-day priorities?
followUp: What did you get wrong initially, and how did you course-correct?

text: Imagine Curacel wants to double customer acquisition in 6 months with a constrained budget. How would you decide which channels to prioritize and why?
followUp: What metrics would you monitor weekly to know if your strategy is working?

text: Describe a growth initiative you led that did not deliver the expected results. How did you handle stakeholder communication and next steps?
followUp: What specific lesson from that experience still influences how you operate today?

text: How have you previously balanced short-term acquisition wins with long-term brand or product marketing investments?
followUp: Can you give an example where focusing too much on one hurt the other?

text: Suppose you join Curacel and notice growth is slowing due to low activation after sign-up. What steps would you take in your first month to address this?
followUp: Who would you collaborate with internally, and how would you drive urgency?

text: Walk me through how you’ve used data (e.g., retention, NPS, revenue) to influence executive decision-making.
followUp: Tell me about a time leadership disagreed with your data-driven recommendation—what happened?

text: How do you personally stay energized and motivated when growth targets are aggressive and timelines are tight?
followUp: What signs tell you that you or your team are close to burnout, and how do you respond?

text: Describe a time you identified an unconventional growth opportunity others overlooked. What made you see that possibility?
followUp: How did you validate the idea before fully committing resources?

text: If given ownership of partnerships as a growth lever, how would you evaluate which partnerships are worth pursuing?
followUp: Can you share an example where a partnership failed or succeeded dramatically?

text: What does empowered action mean to you in a leadership role, and how have you modeled it for your team?
followUp: Tell me about a decision you made quickly with incomplete information—what was the outcome?

text: Tell me about a time you were asked to build or significantly scale a growth or marketing function from scratch. What was your approach and what were the first 90-day priorities?
Imagine Curacel wants to double customer acquisition in 6 months with a constrained budget. How would you decide which channels to prioritize and why?
Describe a growth initiative you led that did not deliver the expected results. How did you handle stakeholder communication and next steps?
How have you previously balanced short-term acquisition wins with long-term brand or product marketing investments?
Suppose you join Curacel and notice growth is slowing due to low activation after sign-up. What steps would you take in your first month to address this?
Walk me through how you’ve used data (e.g., retention, NPS, revenue) to influence executive decision-making.
Describe a time you identified an unconventional growth opportunity others overlooked. What made you see that possibility?
If given ownership of partnerships as a growth lever, how would you evaluate which partnerships are worth pursuing?
What does empowered action mean to you in a leadership role, and how have you modeled it for your team?

Imagine Curacel wants to double qualified pipeline in 6 months with limited budget and no existing growth team. Walk me through how you would design and execute a growth strategy across product marketing, performance, and partnerships in your first 90 days.
followUp: How would you decide what *not* to pursue, and what specific metrics would you review weekly to know if you’re moving fast enough or need to pivot?

text: Imagine Curacel is expanding aggressively into Francophone Africa and the Middle East, but your core growth team operates primarily in English. How would you design and execute a growth strategy that accounts for language, cultural nuances, and local buying behaviors while still moving with urgency?
followUp: Can you share a past experience where language or cultural barriers affected growth outcomes, and what specific actions you took to adapt your strategy?

text: Tell me about a time you worked on a problem in an industry or domain you were deeply passionate about. How did that passion influence your results?
followUp: What did you do differently because you genuinely cared about the outcome?

text: Describe a situation where you had to learn a new skill or concept very quickly to deliver on a goal.
followUp: How did you structure your learning, and what would you improve if faced with a similar challenge again?

text: Can you share an example of a time you took ownership of a problem that wasn’t explicitly assigned to you?
followUp: What risks did you consider, and how did you manage stakeholder expectations?

text: Imagine a critical customer issue arises that could impact claims processing timelines. How would you respond in the first 24 hours?
followUp: How would you balance speed with accuracy in your response?

text: Tell me about a time you had to make a decision with incomplete data.
followUp: What signals or assumptions did you rely on, and how did you validate them later?

text: Describe a process or product you improved by thinking creatively or challenging existing assumptions.
followUp: What resistance did you face, and how did you get buy-in?

text: How do you typically measure success in your work, especially when outcomes are not immediately visible?
followUp: Can you give an example where your definition of success changed over time?

text: In a cross-functional team with differing priorities, how do you ensure progress doesn’t stall?
followUp: Tell me about a time this approach didn’t work and what you learned.

text: What experience do you have working with APIs, data integrations, or automated workflows, especially in regulated environments?
followUp: What trade-offs have you had to make between speed, reliability, and compliance?

text: What excites you most about working in an insurtech company like Curacel, and where do you think you could create the most value?
followUp: How do Curacel’s PRESS values show up in how you want to work day-to-day?

text: What personally excites you about building growth at an insurtech company like Curacel, especially in emerging markets?
followUp: Can you share a moment when your passion for the problem you were solving directly influenced business results?

text: Tell me about a time you had to build or significantly evolve a growth strategy from scratch with limited structure or resources.
followUp: What did you get wrong initially, and how did you adjust your approach?

text: How do you typically balance speed versus quality when making high-impact growth decisions?
followUp: Can you give an example where moving fast paid off—or backfired?

text: As a Growth Lead, how do you define ownership beyond your formal job description?
followUp: Describe a situation where you stepped into an unassigned problem and drove it to resolution.

text: What does ‘relentless growth’ mean to you personally, and how do you practice it as a leader?
followUp: How do you ensure your team adopts the same mindset without burning out?

text: Describe a time you had to challenge existing assumptions or norms to unlock new growth opportunities.
followUp: What resistance did you face, and how did you handle it?

text: How do you stay motivated and effective when growth experiments fail repeatedly?
followUp: What signals tell you when to persist versus pivot?

text: What kind of company culture brings out your best work, and what kind limits your impact?
followUp: Based on what you know so far, where do you think Curacel might challenge you the most?

text: If you joined Curacel and had full autonomy for your first 90 days, what would you focus on and why?
followUp: What would success look like at the end of that period?

text: Why is now the right time in your career to take on a Growth Lead role at Curacel?
followUp: What would make you feel, two years from now, that joining Curacel was the right decision?

text: What personally excites you about building growth at an insurtech company like Curacel, especially in emerging markets?
Tell me about a time you had to build or significantly evolve a growth strategy from scratch with limited structure or resources.
How do you typically balance speed versus quality when making high-impact growth decisions?
As a Growth Lead, how do you define ownership beyond your formal job description?

Why is now the right time in your career to take on a Growth Lead role at Curacel?
Walk me through the most impactful growth initiative you’ve led end-to-end. What was the baseline, what channels did you choose, and what measurable results did you deliver?
followUp: Which metric mattered most to leadership, and how did you influence it over time?

text: Tell me about a time you had to build or significantly improve a growth or marketing function from scratch.
followUp: What did you personally execute versus delegate in the first 90 days?

text: Imagine you join Curacel and there is no clear growth playbook yet. What would your first 60–90 day growth plan look like?
followUp: Which channels would you deprioritize initially, and why?

text: Describe a situation where growth targets were aggressive and time was limited. How did you decide what to focus on?
followUp: What trade-offs did you make, and what was the outcome?

text: Can you share a time when a growth experiment failed? What did you learn and what did you change afterward?
followUp: How did that failure influence your next strategy?

text: How have you balanced brand-building initiatives with performance-driven growth in your previous roles?
followUp: Which side has delivered more impact for you, and how did you measure it?

text: Tell me about a time you had to work closely with founders or executives to influence growth direction.
followUp: What data or narrative helped you gain buy-in?

text: Describe a growth opportunity others overlooked but you identified and acted on.
followUp: What insight led you to see that possibility before others?

text: How do you track and forecast key growth metrics like retention, revenue, and NPS on a regular basis?
followUp: Which metric do you believe is most predictive of sustainable growth, and why?

text: We operate in multiple markets. Can you briefly introduce yourself and answer this question in Spanish: ¿Cómo impulsarías el crecimiento de Curacel en un nuevo mercado?
followUp: How comfortable are you leading partnerships or campaigns in Spanish-speaking markets?

Curacel operates in fast-moving, diverse markets, and we’re expanding deeper into Francophone regions where cultural context and communication nuances really matter—what motivates you to take ownership of people operations in environments that may be unfamiliar or evolving, and how would you approach building trust and clarity there?
followUp: Can you share a concrete example of a time you had to quickly adapt your people-support approach to a new culture, team dynamic, or way of working, and what you learned from it?
